alert.note: Alert for Butler; Chase; Marion (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 12:22AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Chase, northeastern Butler and southeastern Marion Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1221 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Burns, or 8 miles south of Florence, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Very heavy rain may produce ponding water on roadways, increasing the risk of hydroplaning. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood Falls, Strong City, Burns, Cassoday, Bazaar, Elmdale, Matfield Green, Cedar Point, Hymer, Wonsevu, Tallgrass Prairie, Saffordville, Tallgrass Prairie Preserve and El Dorado Lake. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 79 and 115. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
